bug.author: xaviera86
bug.summary: how to run CARLA0.9.3 with Windows10

comments.comment:
I try to run Carla0.9.3 with windows10. this is my step to run it. c:\Carla\CARLA_0.9.3_windows>CarlaUE4.exe but when I excute the client side, I got these errors like below. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
c:\Carla\CARLA_0.9.3_windows>python manual_control.py Traceback (most recent call last): File "manual_control.py", line 91, in import carla File "PythonAPI\carla-0.9.3-py3.7-win-amd64.egg\carla_init_.py", line 7, in File "PythonAPI\carla-0.9.3-py3.7-win-amd64.egg\carla\libcarla.py", line 7, in File "PythonAPI\carla-0.9.3-py3.7-win-amd64.egg\carla\libcarla.py", line 6, in bootstrap File "C:\＊＊＊＊＊\Python\Python37\lib\imp.py", line 342, in load_dynamic return _load(spec) ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
is here someone can help me?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/xaviera86>@xaviera86</denchmark-link>
Can you try my branch ?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/marcgpuig>@marcgpuig</denchmark-link> Hi, I also encounter this problem on 0.9.4, with windows 10

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/marcgpuig>@marcgpuig</denchmark-link> i am encountering this issue too. downloaded 0.9.4 windows build. ran easy_install for the carla-0.9.4-py3.7-win-amd64.egg tried import carla in a python shell - and get <denchmark-code> from .libcarla import * ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found. </denchmark-code>
please help
Confirm the issue. Same problem on the same system (Windows 10), Carla version 0.9.4
The same problem for me. Windows 10 and Carla 0.9.4
Problem fixed. I've just installed anaconda on my PC and build the environment with.
As a workaround, you can try to copy an x64 zlib.dll where you have your .py files. If you compiled the project yourself, you will find a zlib.dll in Build/zlib-install/bin.
Yes. It works via Anaconda, but according to docs it suppose to work without it, right?

As a workaround, you can try to copy an x64 zlib.dll where you have your .py files. If you compiled the project yourself, you will find a zlib.dll in Build/zlib-install/bin.
I'm using the precompiled windows build version 0.9.10. I'm running into the same issue File "spawn_npc.py", line 24, in import carla File "C:\Users\Rahul\Documents\WindowsNoEditor\PythonAPI\carla_init_.py", line 8, in from .libcarla import * File "C:\Users\Rahul\Documents\WindowsNoEditor\PythonAPI\carla\libcarla.py", line 7, in bootstrap() File "C:\Users\Rahul\Documents\WindowsNoEditor\PythonAPI\carla\libcarla.py", line 6, in bootstrap imp.load_dynamic(name,file) File "C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\PythonSoftwareFoundation.Python.3.8_3.8.1776.0_x64__qbz5n2kfra8p0\lib\imp.py", line 342, in load_dynamic return _load(spec) ImportError: DLL load failed while importing libcarla: The specified module could not be found. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marcgpuig>@marcgpuig</denchmark-link>
I found the zlib.dll file but I'm not sure where exactly I'm supposed to copy the file into. Could you clarify the what you mean by "where your .py files are" . Thanks!
